alert.note: Alert for DeSoto (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 07 at 9:14PM EDT until October 10 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Myakka River At Myakka River State Park affecting Sarasota County. Peace River At Zolfo Springs at SR 17 affecting Hardee County. Peace River At Arcadia at SR 70 affecting DeSoto County. Peace River At Bartow affecting Polk County. Horse Creek Near Arcadia at SR 72 affecting DeSoto County. .Minor to major river flooding continues in the wake of the heavy rainfall associated with former Hurricane Ian. Flood waters are expected to gradually recede during the next weeks. For the Myakka...including Myakka River State Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Peace...including Bartow, Zolfo Springs at SR 17, Arcadia at SR 70...Major flooding is forecast. For the Horse Creek...including Arcadia at SR 72...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Horse Creek Near Arcadia at SR 72. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Buildings in Hidden Acres flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EDT Friday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EDT Friday was 14.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Sunday evening and continue falling to 11.1 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.0 feet on 09/07/1959. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Tue Wed Horse Creek Arcadia at SR 7 12.0 14.0 Fri 8 pm 13.0 12.0 11.1 10.1 9.5 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 1215 PM EDT.
